      • mapLetterToSquare

        private java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> mapLetterToSquare​(java.lang.String[] move)
        Create a Linked HashMap, with key is the square location and value is the Tile's letter representation.
        Parameters:
        move - ArrayList representing the move make by player, i.e. D.A1 O.A2 G.A3
        Returns:
        a map that map letter to square.

        Parameters:
        chars - the chars Array representation of the tiles player want to swap.

      • determineTileFromChar

        private Tile determineTileFromChar​(char character)
        determine the tile from the player's input and whether the player has that tile.
        Parameters:
        character - the player's input.
        Returns:
        the Tile associated with the character if it's in the player's tray, null otherwise.

      • isFullBoard

        private boolean isFullBoard()
        Check if the board is full.
        Returns:
        true if there is no more free square left in the board, false otherwise.

      • determinePossibleWordCombinations

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Square>> determinePossibleWordCombinations​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> inputWord,
                                                                                           java.lang.String direction,
                                                                                           Board copyBoard)
        determine possible word Combinations from the input word,
        Parameters:
        inputWord - the Square contains the input word.
        direction - moving direction ("H" for horizontal, "V" for vertical). Call determineMoveDirection to determine.
        copyBoard - Board
        Returns:
        the ArrayList contains the ArrayList of Squares that represents the valid word combination. Return null if there is at least one wrong combination.

      • isValidMove

        private Board isValidMove​(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> moves)
        check if a move is valid or not, including dictionary check.
        Parameters:
        moves - the Linked Hash Map with location at key and String tile representation as values.
        Returns:
        null if invalid move, or the validated board since the validation is carried out in a copy version of the main board, made right before validating the move.

      • getWordFromSquareList

        public java.lang.String getWordFromSquareList​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> squares)
        Get the word representing by the ArrayList of Squares.
        Parameters:
        squares - the Squares containing the word/
        Returns:
        the word.

      • determineMoveDirection

        private java.lang.String determineMoveDirection​(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> moves)
        determine the move direction.
        Parameters:
        moves - the player's input move.
        Returns:
        "H" for horizontal, "V" for vertical.

      • getOccupiedSquare

        private java.util.List<Square> getOccupiedSquare​(Board copyBoard,
                                                 java.util.List<Square> playSquares)
        Get the List of Square which is being occupied by a tile on the board.
        Parameters:
        copyBoard - Board to check.
        playSquares - the square which has just recently been placed.
        Returns:
        the List of Occupied Squares.

      • getNextValidSquares

        private void getNextValidSquares​(java.util.List<Square> playSquares,
                                 java.lang.String direction,
                                 Board copyBoard)
        get the valid squares before the move.
        Parameters:
        playSquares - The List contains the squares which represents the moves of the player
        direction - the move direction. "H" for Horizontal, "V" for vertical.
        copyBoard - the board to check.

      • isValidPlacement

        private boolean isValidPlacement​(java.util.List<Square> playSquares,
                                 java.lang.String direction,
                                 Board copyBoard)
        check if a placement is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        playSquares - The List contains the squares which represents the moves of the player
        direction - the move direction. "H" for Horizontal, "V" for vertical.
        copyBoard - the board to check.
        Returns:
        true if the placement adhere to the game rules, false otherwise.
